CLAIMANTS SOUGHT DAMAGES FOR MARKET LOSSES ASSOCIATED WITH A BEAR STEARNS A RATED BOND ALONG WITH AN AMERIQUEST INVESTMENT GRADE BOND, BOTH PURCHASED IN 2006, CLAIMING THAT THE INVESTMENTS HAD BEEN UNSUITABLE.  SUITABILITY IS DETERMINED AT THE POINT OF SALE AND NOT AT SOME LATER DATE WHEN INVESTMENT LOSSES HAVE BEEN INCURRED OR ARE ANTICIPATED. CLAIMANTS HAD INDICATED THAT THEY WERE WILLING TO ASSUME A MODERATE LEVEL OF RISK IN PURSUIT OF THEIR INVESTMENT GOALS.
